snippet: Under proposed rules, creditors could continue offering certain loans as long as they also provide consumers a loan option with no fees or points attached.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau proposes new rules for fees often attached to mortgages, and new restrictions on mortgage loan originators, to help consumers compare loan options; under the proposed rules, creditors could continue offering such loans as long as they also provide consumers a loan option with no fees or points attached.
lead_paragraph: Under proposed rules, creditors could continue offering certain loans as long as they also provide consumers a loan option with no fees or points attached.
